entry.title: Re: [blink-dev] Intent to Ship: CSS advanced attr() function
entry.summary: Re: [blink-dev] Intent to Ship: CSS advanced attr() function
entry.content:
<div class="msgHead"> <h1> <span class="subject"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=subject:%22Re%5C%3A+%5C%5Bblink%5C-dev%5C%5D+Intent+to+Ship%5C%3A+CSS+advanced+attr%5C%28%5C%29+function%22&o=newest" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="name">Re: [blink-dev] Intent to Ship: CSS advanced attr() function</span></a></span> </h1> <p class="darkgray font13"> <span class="sender pipe"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=from:%22Mike+Taylor%22" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">Mike Taylor</span></span></a></span> <span class="date"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=date:20241211" rel="nofollow">Wed, 11 Dec 2024 13:01:58 -0800</a></span> </p> </div><div itemprop="articleBody" class="msgBody">
<pre style="margin: 0em;"> +1 to Vladimir's recommendation here. LGTM2
On 12/11/24 4:00 PM, Vladimir Levin wrote: </pre><blockquote style="border-left: #5555EE solid 0.2em; margin: 0em; padding-left: 0.85em"><pre style="margin: 0em;"> Thanks for the analysis.</pre><pre></pre><tt>I think the compat risk here is low. Since we know of at least 3 </tt><tt>instances that are likely to break, or at least to have a different </tt><tt>behavior, I'd ask that we try to reach out to those sites as an FYI </tt><tt>about this change. </tt><pre style="margin: 0em;">
Other than that, LGTM1
</pre><tt>On Wed, Dec 11, 2024 at 12:42 PM Munira Tursunova <moon...@google.com> </tt><tt>wrote: </tt><pre style="margin: 0em;">
Thank you for your replies.
I notice that we're failing all the tests on
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://wpt.fyi/results/css/css-values?label=master&label=experimental&aligned&q=attr">https://wpt.fyi/results/css/css-values?label=master&label=experimental&aligned&q=attr</a>
<<a rel="nofollow" href="https://wpt.fyi/results/css/css-values?label=master&label=experimental&aligned&q=attr">https://wpt.fyi/results/css/css-values?label=master&label=experimental&aligned&q=attr</a>> , probably because this feature is not available behind the experimental-web-platform-features flag.
Can you confirm that we're passing all the tests with the feature-specific flag enabled? Or are there interesting failures left that are worth highlighting?
Yes, the attr() tests should pass once the runtime flag is enabled.
Regarding potential open spec issues, I found 6
<<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues?q=is%3Aopen+label%3Acss-values-5+attr+in%3Atitle">https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues?q=is%3Aopen+label%3Acss-values-5+attr+in%3Atitle</a>>, including two that the TAG highlighted in their review plus one tagged as "Agenda+" implying it's still an active topic for discussion. If you think we don't need to resolve those issues before shipping, can you explain why in more detail?
I have looked at the issues, most of them are not relevant anymore with the new attr() syntax. This also applies to the open issue mentioned in TAG review (issue 5079 <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/5079">https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/5079</a>>), I don't think this is relevant anymore since according to CSS Values and Units Module Level 5: <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://drafts.csswg.org/css-values-5/#attr-security">https://drafts.csswg.org/css-values-5/#attr-security</a>>
Using an attr()-tainted value as or in a <url> makes a declaration invalid at computed-value time.
There is one issue that might be still relevant (issue 10503 <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/10503">https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/10503</a>>), but I don't think it should block the shipping since it's a serialization issue and the spec might already be interpreted that way.
Beyond what Vlad and Dominic has mentioned, we're also missing formal signals from other vendors. They have requested that we not use generic opinions from staff as official signals. You can find how to get formals vendor signals by following the link "signals on their opinion of the API" in <a rel="nofollow" href="https://www.chromium.org/blink/launching-features/">https://www.chromium.org/blink/launching-features/</a>
Thanks, filed <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/mozilla/standards-positions/issues/1143 and ">https://github.com/mozilla/standards-positions/issues/1143 and </a> <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WebKit/standards-positions/issues/435">https://github.com/WebKit/standards-positions/issues/435</a> <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WebKit/standards-positions/issues/435">https://github.com/WebKit/standards-positions/issues/435</a>>.
The second example
(<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/tursunova/web-platform-explainer/blob/main/advanced-attr-explainer.md#example-2">https://github.com/tursunova/web-platform-explainer/blob/main/advanced-attr-explainer.md#example-2</a> ) seems plausible in that it may be a valid way to organize information on a parent in data attributes and use that in children to display. I have found examples where a similar pattern happens on the element itself (var is set on an element via attr, and then used in element::before's content). I assume that this case will be fine in that the behavior </pre><tt> change won't affect it right? </tt><tt> </tt><pre style="margin: 0em;">
Yes, that should work fine, the only dangerous scenarios are when the attr() function is used on the parent element, but the attribute is defined on the child element.
Regarding compatibility, the scenarios you outlined
<<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/tursunova/web-platform-explainer/blob/main/advanced-attr-explainer.md#backwards-compatibility">https://github.com/tursunova/web-platform-explainer/blob/main/advanced-attr-explainer.md#backwards-compatibility</a>> as changing behavior seem rare enough that I hope they don't cause problems. However, have you made any attempt to quantify them, e.g. via use counter? (It's OK if not.)
Is the plan to roll this out via finch and monitor for breakages?
Is there some data you could reasonably collect (UMA and/or a cluster telemetry run perhaps) to try to put an upper bound on the breaking change risk? I think we all expect that the risk is low, but is it extremely low and so something we should just launch with a finch killswitch ready to use at the first sign of issue, or is it only very low meaning we need to go further - especially for our enterprise change guidelines <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://www.chromium.org/developers/enterprise-changes/">https://www.chromium.org/developers/enterprise-changes/</a>>?
Manually checked the content of the websites from httparchieve query results, most of the pages use body, attr() and var() on the same pseudo element, which shouldn’t cause the breakages. The upper bound percentage for breakages is *~0.005%*. Summed up the analysis for gathered data from httparchieve in the doc
<<a rel="nofollow" href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/15pi0QVsZkOIbxDY6p8tH5v1E-UabMC8aR4YXfYb9C1Q/edit?usp=sharing">https://docs.google.com/document/d/15pi0QVsZkOIbxDY6p8tH5v1E-UabMC8aR4YXfYb9C1Q/edit?usp=sharing</a>>.
Thank you, Munira
On Wed, Dec 4, 2024 at 5:41 PM Rick Byers <rby...@chromium.org> wrote:
Discussed in API owners meeting today that we don't really understand the compat risk here. Vlad makes a compelling argument that the risk in example #2 may be non-trivial (especially when considering inheritance scenarios beyond just custom properties). Also you'll need to request enterprise review and they're going to want to know what the extent of the compat risk is (do we need a policy opt-out and 3-release heads up in the release notes?).
Is there some data you could reasonably collect (UMA and/or a cluster telemetry run perhaps) to try to put an upper bound on the breaking change risk? I think we all expect that the risk is low, but is it extremely low and so something we should just launch with a finch killswitch ready to use at the first sign of issue, or is it only very low meaning we need to go further - especially for our enterprise change guidelines <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://www.chromium.org/developers/enterprise-changes/">https://www.chromium.org/developers/enterprise-changes/</a>>?
Thanks, Rick
On Wed, Dec 4, 2024 at 9:43 AM Daniel Bratell <bratel...@gmail.com> wrote:
Beyond what Vlad and Dominic has mentioned, we're also missing formal signals from other vendors. They have requested that we not use generic opinions from staff as official signals. You can find how to get formals vendor signals by following the link "signals on their opinion of the API" in <a rel="nofollow" href="https://www.chromium.org/blink/launching-features/">https://www.chromium.org/blink/launching-features/</a>
/Daniel
On 2024-12-04 03:29, Vladimir Levin wrote: </pre><blockquote style="border-left: #5555EE solid 0.2em; margin: 0em; padding-left: 0.85em"><pre style="margin: 0em;">
On Mon, Dec 2, 2024 at 10:47 PM Domenic Denicola <dome...@chromium.org> wrote:
Thank you, that explainer is very helpful!
I notice that we're failing all the tests on
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://wpt.fyi/results/css/css-values?label=master&label=experimental&aligned&q=attr">https://wpt.fyi/results/css/css-values?label=master&label=experimental&aligned&q=attr</a>
<<a rel="nofollow" href="https://wpt.fyi/results/css/css-values?label=master&label=experimental&aligned&q=attr">https://wpt.fyi/results/css/css-values?label=master&label=experimental&aligned&q=attr</a>> , probably because this feature is not available behind the experimental-web-platform-features flag.
Can you confirm that we're passing all the tests with the feature-specific flag enabled? Or are there interesting failures left that are worth highlighting?
Regarding compatibility, the scenarios you outlined
<<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/tursunova/web-platform-explainer/blob/main/advanced-attr-explainer.md#backwards-compatibility">https://github.com/tursunova/web-platform-explainer/blob/main/advanced-attr-explainer.md#backwards-compatibility</a>> as changing behavior seem rare enough that I hope they don't cause problems. However, have you made any attempt to quantify them, e.g. via use counter? (It's OK if not.)
The second example
(<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/tursunova/web-platform-explainer/blob/main/advanced-attr-explainer.md#example-2">https://github.com/tursunova/web-platform-explainer/blob/main/advanced-attr-explainer.md#example-2</a> ) seems plausible in that it may be a valid way to organize information on a parent in data attributes and use that in children to display. I have found examples where a similar pattern happens on the element itself (var is set on an element via attr, and then used in element::before's content). I assume that this case will be fine in that the behavior change won't affect it right? I couldn't find any examples of parent to child var transfer (the breaking case), but that of course doesn't mean that it doesn't exist.
Is the plan to roll this out via finch and monitor for breakages?
Thanks, Vlad
Regarding potential open spec issues, I found 6
<<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues?q=is%3Aopen+label%3Acss-values-5+attr+in%3Atitle">https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues?q=is%3Aopen+label%3Acss-values-5+attr+in%3Atitle</a>>, including two that the TAG highlighted in their review plus one tagged as "Agenda+" implying it's still an active topic for discussion. If you think we don't need to resolve those issues before shipping, can you explain why in more detail?
On Tue, Dec 3, 2024 at 12:31 AM Munira Tursunova <moon...@google.com> wrote:
Thank you, Domenic!
I uploaded explainer here:
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/tursunova/web-platform-explainer/blob/main/advanced-attr-explainer.md">https://github.com/tursunova/web-platform-explainer/blob/main/advanced-attr-explainer.md</a>.
On Wed, Nov 27, 2024 at 3:02 AM Domenic Denicola <dome...@chromium.org> wrote:
On Tue, Nov 26, 2024 at 8:07 PM Chromestatus <ad...@cr-status.appspotmail.com> wrote:
Contact emails
moon...@google.com, chris...@chromium.org
Explainer
None
Some sort of explainer would be appreciated for this change, especially given the security complexity.
Specification
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://drafts.csswg.org/css-values-5/#attr-notation">https://drafts.csswg.org/css-values-5/#attr-notation</a>
Summary
Implement the augmentation to attr() specified in CSS Level 5, which allows types besides <string> and usage in all CSS properties (besides pseudo-element 'content'). Example: <style> div { background-color: attr(data-foo type(<color>), red); } </style> <div data-foo="blue">test</div>
Blink component
Blink>CSS
<<a rel="nofollow" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/list?q=component:Blink%3ECSS">https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/list?q=component:Blink%3ECSS</a>>
Search tags
css <<a rel="nofollow" href="http:///features#tags:css">http:///features#tags:css</a>>, css-values <<a rel="nofollow" href="http:///features#tags:css-values">http:///features#tags:css-values</a>>, attr <<a rel="nofollow" href="http:///features#tags:attr">http:///features#tags:attr</a>>
TAG review
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/w3ctag/design-reviews/issues/513">https://github.com/w3ctag/design-reviews/issues/513</a>
TAG review status
Pending
Risks
Interoperability and Compatibility
No browser has implemented this feature yet. Even though there's no negative signals from other browsers, there's still a minimal interoperability risk that we end up the only implementation. There are also a few known cases where this advanced version behaves differently from the basic version in pseudo-element content property, which is a compatibility risk: - <a rel="nofollow" href="https://bit.ly/2XDhHtg">https://bit.ly/2XDhHtg</a> - <a rel="nofollow" href="https://bit.ly/3grF3ur">https://bit.ly/3grF3ur</a>
/Gecko/: No signal
(<a rel="nofollow" href="https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=435426">https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=435426</a>)
/WebKit/: No signal (<a rel="nofollow" href="https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=26609">https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=26609</a>)
/Web developers/: No signals
/Other signals/:
Security
attr() can be used by injected CSS for data exfiltration. <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/5092">https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/5092</a>
How have you resolved these security issues? (A writeup as part of an explainer, perhaps with an alternatives considered section, would help here.)
WebView application risks
Does this intent deprecate or change behavior of existing APIs, such that it has potentially high risk for Android WebView-based applications?
None
Debuggability
No additional DevTools support is needed. attr() function is inspectable in DevTools same way as any other CSS substitution function.
Will this feature be supported on all six Blink platforms (Windows, Mac, Linux, ChromeOS, Android, and Android WebView)?
Yes
Is this feature fully tested by web-platform-tests
<<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/docs/testing/web_platform_tests.md">https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/docs/testing/web_platform_tests.md</a>>?
Yes
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://wpt.fyi/results/css/css-values?label=master&label=experimental&aligned&q=attr">https://wpt.fyi/results/css/css-values?label=master&label=experimental&aligned&q=attr</a>
<<a rel="nofollow" href="https://wpt.fyi/results/css/css-values?label=master&label=experimental&aligned&q=attr">https://wpt.fyi/results/css/css-values?label=master&label=experimental&aligned&q=attr</a>>
Flag name on about://flags
CSSAdvancedAttrFunction
Finch feature name
CSSAdvancedAttrFunction
Requires code in //chrome?
False
Tracking bug
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=246571">https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=246571</a>
Estimated milestones
Shipping on desktop 133 Shipping on Android 133 Shipping on WebView 133
Anticipated spec changes
Open questions about a feature may be a source of future web compat or interop issues. Please list open issues (e.g. links to known github issues in the project for the feature specification) whose resolution may introduce web compat/interop risk (e.g., changing to naming or structure of the API in a non-backward-compatible way).
None
Link to entry on the Chrome Platform Status
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/feature/4680129030651904?gate=5932337540366336">https://chromestatus.com/feature/4680129030651904?gate=5932337540366336</a>
This intent message was generated by Chrome Platform Status <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com">https://chromestatus.com</a>>. </pre><tt> -- </tt><tt> You received this message because you are </tt><pre style="margin: 0em;"> subscribed to the Google Groups "blink-dev" group. To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to blink-dev+unsubscr...@chromium.org. To view this discussion visit
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/6745abd8.2b0a0220.19a388.0324.GAE%40google.com">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/6745abd8.2b0a0220.19a388.0324.GAE%40google.com</a>
<<a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/6745abd8.2b0a0220.19a388.0324.GAE%40google.com?utm_medium=email&utm_source=footer">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/6745abd8.2b0a0220.19a388.0324.GAE%40google.com?utm_medium=email&utm_source=footer</a>>.
</pre><tt> -- </tt><tt> You received this message because you are subscribed </tt><pre style="margin: 0em;"> to the Google Groups "blink-dev" group. To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to blink-dev+unsubscr...@chromium.org. To view this discussion visit

entry.title: [blink-dev] Intent to Ship: Protected Audience (B&A) - Selectable Reporting IDs
entry.summary: [blink-dev] Intent to Ship: Protected Audience (B&A) - Selectable Reporting IDs
entry.content:
<div class="msgHead"> <h1> <span class="subject"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=subject:%22%5C%5Bblink%5C-dev%5C%5D+Intent+to+Ship%5C%3A+Protected+Audience+%5C%28B%5C%26A%5C%29+%5C-+Selectable+Reporting+IDs%22&o=newest" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="name">[blink-dev] Intent to Ship: Protected Audience (B&A) - Selectable Reporting IDs</span></a></span> </h1> <p class="darkgray font13"> <span class="sender pipe"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=from:%22Paul+Jensen%22" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">Paul Jensen</span></span></a></span> <span class="date"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=date:20241213" rel="nofollow">Fri, 13 Dec 2024 07:42:40 -0800</a></span> </p> </div><div itemprop="articleBody" class="msgBody">
<pre>Contact emails
pauljen...@chromium.org</pre><pre>
Explainer
For original Protected Audience Selectable Reporting IDs support: <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/pull/1237">https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/pull/1237</a>
Specification
Web spec: <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/pull/1348">https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/pull/1348</a>
Protocol spec: <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/privacysandbox/draft-ietf-bidding-and-auction-services/pull/14">https://github.com/privacysandbox/draft-ietf-bidding-and-auction-services/pull/14</a>
Summary
Chrome already provides a selectable reporting ID to the Protected Audience API <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/1cWqBPHngd0">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/1cWqBPHngd0</a>> to facilitate event-level Protected Audience auction reporting on Deal and Seat IDs which are sometimes associated with programmatic deals(aka private marketplace). This feature adds Chrome support for selectable reporting IDs for Protected Audience ad selection auctions run on Bidding and Auction Services (B&A) <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/privacysandbox/protected-auction-services-docs/blob/main/bidding_auction_services_api.md">https://github.com/privacysandbox/protected-auction-services-docs/blob/main/bidding_auction_services_api.md</a>> .
Blink component
Blink>InterestGroups <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/list?q=component:Blink%3EInterestGroups">https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/list?q=component:Blink%3EInterestGroups</a>>
TAG review
For Protected Audience: <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/w3ctag/design-reviews/issues/723">https://github.com/w3ctag/design-reviews/issues/723</a>
For Protected Audience Bidding and Auction Services: <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/w3ctag/design-reviews/issues/1009">https://github.com/w3ctag/design-reviews/issues/1009</a>
TAG review status
Completed for Protected Audience, resolved unsatisfied.
RisksInteroperability and Compatibility
Feature represents optional new behavior that shouldn’t break existing usage.
Gecko & WebKit: For Protected Audiences in general - Negative from Mozilla <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/mozilla/standards-positions/issues/770#issuecomment-2432124085">https://github.com/mozilla/standards-positions/issues/770#issuecomment-2432124085</a>>. No signal from Webkit <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WebKit/standards-positions/issues/158#issuecomment-2432121278">https://github.com/WebKit/standards-positions/issues/158#issuecomment-2432121278</a>> .
Edge: Edge is running an Origin Trial of the Ad Selection API <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WICG/privacy-preserving-ads/blob/main/README.md">https://github.com/WICG/privacy-preserving-ads/blob/main/README.md</a>> which shares a Web API and services protocol with PA.
Web developers: Selectable reporting IDs in Protected Audience requested by 6+ companies (including Microsoft Ads) in 4 GitHub issues (1 <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/issues/873">https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/issues/873</a>>,2 <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/issues/716">https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/issues/716</a>>,3 <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/issues/682">https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/issues/682</a>>,4 <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/issues/686">https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/issues/686</a>>).
Debuggability
On-device API surfaces should be debuggable in Chrome DevTools, and we’ve added extensive mechanisms for debugging <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/privacysandbox/fledge-docs/blob/main/debugging_protected_audience_api_services.md">https://github.com/privacysandbox/fledge-docs/blob/main/debugging_protected_audience_api_services.md</a>> Bidding and Auction services <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/privacysandbox/protected-auction-services-docs/blob/main/bidding_auction_services_api.md#related-documents">https://github.com/privacysandbox/protected-auction-services-docs/blob/main/bidding_auction_services_api.md#related-documents</a>> .
Will this feature be supported on all six Blink platforms (Windows, Mac, Linux, ChromeOS, Android, and Android WebView)?
It will be supported on all platforms that support Protected Audience, so all but WebView.
Is this feature fully tested by web-platform-tests <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/docs/testing/web_platform_tests.md">https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/docs/testing/web_platform_tests.md</a>> ?
We plan to add WPTs to cover this API shortly. We already have WPTs for Protected Audience Bidding and Auction Services and for Protected Audience selectable reporting IDs and will extend these accordingly.
Flag name on chrome://flags
None
Finch feature name
EnableBandADealSupport
Requires code in //chrome?
False
Estimated milestones
Shipping on desktop and Android in M132.
Anticipated spec changes
None
Link to entry on the Chrome Platform Status
<a rel="nofollow" href="http://chromestatus/6112108595642368">http://chromestatus/6112108595642368</a>
This intent message was generated by Chrome Platform Status <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/">https://chromestatus.com/</a>>.
-- You received this message because you are subscribed to the Google Groups "blink-dev" group. To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to blink-dev+unsubscr...@chromium.org. To view this discussion visit <a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/CABQTWrnv-kyAnRATmzj1mVNKQSOJockCt_bs%3D%3Da5K75E%2BiMArA%40mail.gmail.com">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/CABQTWrnv-kyAnRATmzj1mVNKQSOJockCt_bs%3D%3Da5K75E%2BiMArA%40mail.gmail.com</a>. </pre>
</div>

entry.title: [blink-dev] Intent to Ship: Add MediaStreamTrack support to the Web Speech API
entry.summary: [blink-dev] Intent to Ship: Add MediaStreamTrack support to the Web Speech API
entry.content:
<div class="msgHead"> <h1> <span class="subject"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=subject:%22%5C%5Bblink%5C-dev%5C%5D+Intent+to+Ship%5C%3A+Add+MediaStreamTrack+support+to+the+Web+Speech+API%22&o=newest" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="name">[blink-dev] Intent to Ship: Add MediaStreamTrack support to the Web Speech API</span></a></span> </h1> <p class="darkgray font13"> <span class="sender pipe"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=from:%22Chromestatus%22" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">Chromestatus</span></span></a></span> <span class="date"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=date:20241217" rel="nofollow">Tue, 17 Dec 2024 16:28:03 -0800</a></span> </p> </div><div itemprop="articleBody" class="msgBody">
<pre>Contact emails ev...@google.com </pre><pre>
Explainer <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WICG/speech-api/pull/118">https://github.com/WICG/speech-api/pull/118</a>
Specification <a rel="nofollow" href="https://wicg.github.io/speech-api">https://wicg.github.io/speech-api</a>
Design docs
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1LHGtO6A-U4OFQpG9LXUf1_4Elerpv1rncNCbHnmA7zY/edit?usp=sharing">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1LHGtO6A-U4OFQpG9LXUf1_4Elerpv1rncNCbHnmA7zY/edit?usp=sharing</a>
Summary
Add MediaStreamTrack support to the Web Speech API. The Web Speech API is a web standard API that allows developers to incorporate speech recognition and synthesis into their web pages. Currently, the Web Speech API uses the user's default microphone as the audio input. MediaStreamTrack support allows websites to use the Web Speech API to caption other sources of audio including remote audio tracks.
Blink component Blink>Speech
Search tags speech, recognition
TAG review None
TAG review status Not applicable
Risks
Interoperability and Compatibility
None
Gecko: Positive (<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WICG/speech-api/issues/66">https://github.com/WICG/speech-api/issues/66</a>) Similar changes proposed by Firefox in 2019
WebKit: Positive (<a rel="nofollow" href="https://www.w3.org/Bugs/Public/show_bug.cgi?id=26336">https://www.w3.org/Bugs/Public/show_bug.cgi?id=26336</a>) Similar changes proposed by Safari in 2014
Web developers: Positive (<a rel="nofollow" href="https://stackoverflow.com/questions/67351357/web-speech-recognition-on-mediastream">https://stackoverflow.com/questions/67351357/web-speech-recognition-on-mediastream</a>) Feature requested by web developers
Other signals:
WebView application risks
Does this intent deprecate or change behavior of existing APIs, such that it has potentially high risk for Android WebView-based applications?
None
Debuggability
None
Will this feature be supported on all six Blink platforms (Windows, Mac, Linux, ChromeOS, Android, and Android WebView)? No Initially supported on Windows, Mac, and Linux with ChromeOS support to follow.
Is this feature fully tested by web-platform-tests? No
Flag name on about://flags None
Finch feature name MediaStreamTrackWebSpeech
Requires code in //chrome? False
Estimated milestones
Shipping on desktop 133
Anticipated spec changes
Open questions about a feature may be a source of future web compat or interop issues. Please list open issues (eg links to known github issues in the project for the feature specification) whose resolution may introduce web compat/interop risk (eg, changing to naming or structure of the API in a non-backward-compatible way). Spec changes will be made to the Web Speech API spec after the spec repo migrates over to the Audio Community Group. Tentative spec PR changes: <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WICG/speech-api/pull/118">https://github.com/WICG/speech-api/pull/118</a>
Link to entry on the Chrome Platform Status <a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/feature/5178378197139456?gate=5091779878846464">https://chromestatus.com/feature/5178378197139456?gate=5091779878846464</a>
This intent message was generated by Chrome Platform Status.
-- You received this message because you are subscribed to the Google Groups "blink-dev" group. To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to blink-dev+unsubscr...@chromium.org. To view this discussion visit <a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/6762170b.2b0a0220.38516f.0183.GAE%40google.com">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/6762170b.2b0a0220.38516f.0183.GAE%40google.com</a>. </pre>
</div>

entry.title: [blink-dev] Intent to Ship: Protected Audience (B&A) - Private Aggregation & downsampling forDebuggingOnly reporting
entry.summary: [blink-dev] Intent to Ship: Protected Audience (B&A) - Private Aggregation & downsampling forDebuggingOnly reporting
entry.content:
<div class="msgHead"> <h1> <span class="subject"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=subject:%22%5C%5Bblink%5C-dev%5C%5D+Intent+to+Ship%5C%3A+Protected+Audience+%5C%28B%5C%26A%5C%29+%5C-+Private+Aggregation+%5C%26+downsampling+forDebuggingOnly+reporting%22&o=newest" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="name">[blink-dev] Intent to Ship: Protected Audience (B&A) - Private Aggregation & downsampling forDebuggingOnly reporting</span></a></span> </h1> <p class="darkgray font13"> <span class="sender pipe"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=from:%22Paul+Jensen%22" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">Paul Jensen</span></span></a></span> <span class="date"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=date:20241217" rel="nofollow">Tue, 17 Dec 2024 12:45:17 -0800</a></span> </p> </div><div itemprop="articleBody" class="msgBody">
<pre>Contact emails
pauljen...@chromium.org</pre><pre>
qingxi...@google.com
Explainer
For original Protected Audience Private Aggregation reporting support: <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/pull/386">https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/pull/386</a>
For original Protected Audience downsampling forDebuggingOnly reporting: <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/pull/1020">https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/pull/1020</a>
Specification
Private aggregation reporting:
-
Web spec: <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/pull/1344">https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/pull/1344</a> -
Protocol spec:
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/privacysandbox/draft-ietf-bidding-and-auction-services/pull/15">https://github.com/privacysandbox/draft-ietf-bidding-and-auction-services/pull/15</a>
Downsampling fDO:
-
Web spec: <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/pull/1325">https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/pull/1325</a> -
Protocol spec:
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/privacysandbox/draft-ietf-bidding-and-auction-services/pull/17">https://github.com/privacysandbox/draft-ietf-bidding-and-auction-services/pull/17</a>
Summary
This feature adds changes necessary in Chrome to support two reporting mechanisms for Protected Audience (PA) auctions run on Bidding and Auction Services (B&A) <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/privacysandbox/protected-auction-services-docs/blob/main/bidding_auction_services_api.md">https://github.com/privacysandbox/protected-auction-services-docs/blob/main/bidding_auction_services_api.md</a>> :
1.
Private Aggregation Reporting: for measuring aggregate, cross-site data in a privacy preserving manner. 2.
Downsampling of forDebuggingOnly (fDO) reports: changes necessary in the client to support the eventual implementation of downsampling of fDO in B&A. Chrome previously supported these reporting mechanisms for on-device PA auctions, and this feature brings them to B&A on-server auctions.
Blink component
Blink>InterestGroups <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/list?q=component:Blink%3EInterestGroups">https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/list?q=component:Blink%3EInterestGroups</a>>
TAG review
For Protected Audience: <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/w3ctag/design-reviews/issues/723">https://github.com/w3ctag/design-reviews/issues/723</a>
For Protected Audience Bidding and Auction Services: <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/w3ctag/design-reviews/issues/1009">https://github.com/w3ctag/design-reviews/issues/1009</a>
TAG review status
Completed for Protected Audience, resolved unsatisfied.
RisksInteroperability and Compatibility
Feature represents optional new behavior that shouldn’t break existing usage.
Gecko & WebKit: For Protected Audiences in general - Negative from Mozilla <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/mozilla/standards-positions/issues/770#issuecomment-2432124085">https://github.com/mozilla/standards-positions/issues/770#issuecomment-2432124085</a>>. No signal from Webkit <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WebKit/standards-positions/issues/158#issuecomment-2432121278">https://github.com/WebKit/standards-positions/issues/158#issuecomment-2432121278</a>> .
Edge: Edge is running an Origin Trial of the Ad Selection API <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WICG/privacy-preserving-ads/blob/main/README.md">https://github.com/WICG/privacy-preserving-ads/blob/main/README.md</a>> which shares a Web API and services protocol with PA. Their auction reporting doc <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WICG/privacy-preserving-ads/blob/main/Auction%20Reporting.md">https://github.com/WICG/privacy-preserving-ads/blob/main/Auction%20Reporting.md</a>> says future work includes aggregate reporting which can be facilitated by this.
Web developers:
Private aggregation reporting in Protected Audience: Discussed on github (1 <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/issues/164">https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/issues/164</a>>, 2 <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/issues/16">https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/issues/16</a>>, 3 <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/issues/54">https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/issues/54</a>>, 4 <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/issues/289">https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/issues/289</a>>, 5 <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/patcg-individual-drafts/private-aggregation-api/issues/12">https://github.com/patcg-individual-drafts/private-aggregation-api/issues/12</a>> ).
Downsampled forDebuggingOnly in Protected Audience: Discussed here <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/issues/632">https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/issues/632</a>> and in person here <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/blob/main/meetings/2024-01-17-FLEDGE-call-minutes.md#:~:text=on%20the%20URL.-,forDebuggingOnly%20availability,-%2D%20%23632">https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/blob/main/meetings/2024-01-17-FLEDGE-call-minutes.md#:~:text=on%20the%20URL.-,forDebuggingOnly%20availability,-%2D%20%23632</a>> .
Debuggability
On-device API surfaces should be debuggable in Chrome DevTools, and we’ve added extensive mechanisms for debugging <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/privacysandbox/fledge-docs/blob/main/debugging_protected_audience_api_services.md">https://github.com/privacysandbox/fledge-docs/blob/main/debugging_protected_audience_api_services.md</a>> Bidding and Auction services <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/privacysandbox/protected-auction-services-docs/blob/main/bidding_auction_services_api.md#related-documents">https://github.com/privacysandbox/protected-auction-services-docs/blob/main/bidding_auction_services_api.md#related-documents</a>> .
Will this feature be supported on all six Blink platforms (Windows, Mac, Linux, ChromeOS, Android, and Android WebView)?
It will be supported on all platforms that support Protected Audience, so all but WebView.
Is this feature fully tested by web-platform-tests <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/docs/testing/web_platform_tests.md">https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/docs/testing/web_platform_tests.md</a>> ?
We plan to add WPTs to cover this API shortly. We already have WPTs for Protected Audience Bidding and Auction Services and for Protected Audience private aggregation reporting, and will extend these accordingly.
Flag name on chrome://flags
None
Finch feature name
EnableBandAPrivateAggregation,
EnableBandASampleDebugReports
Requires code in //chrome?
False
Estimated milestones
Shipping on desktop and Android in M132.
Anticipated spec changes
None
Link to entry on the Chrome Platform Status
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/feature/5150193518116864">https://chromestatus.com/feature/5150193518116864</a>
This intent message was generated by Chrome Platform Status <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/">https://chromestatus.com/</a>>.
-- You received this message because you are subscribed to the Google Groups "blink-dev" group. To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to blink-dev+unsubscr...@chromium.org. To view this discussion visit <a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/CABQTWr%3DAvniF65_Md9iEt_Ws6jML20b7XSu0S8utViDSan3p8g%40mail.gmail.com">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/CABQTWr%3DAvniF65_Md9iEt_Ws6jML20b7XSu0S8utViDSan3p8g%40mail.gmail.com</a>. </pre>
</div>

entry.title: Re: [blink-dev] Intent to Extend Experiment: Storage Access Headers
entry.summary: Re: [blink-dev] Intent to Extend Experiment: Storage Access Headers
entry.content:
<div class="msgHead"> <h1> <span class="subject"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=subject:%22Re%5C%3A+%5C%5Bblink%5C-dev%5C%5D+Intent+to+Extend+Experiment%5C%3A+Storage+Access+Headers%22&o=newest" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="name">Re: [blink-dev] Intent to Extend Experiment: Storage Access Headers</span></a></span> </h1> <p class="darkgray font13"> <span class="sender pipe"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=from:%22Mike+Taylor%22" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">Mike Taylor</span></span></a></span> <span class="date"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=date:20241217" rel="nofollow">Tue, 17 Dec 2024 12:36:48 -0800</a></span> </p> </div><div itemprop="articleBody" class="msgBody">
<tt>Thanks Chris and Sam. The spec work and tests demonstrated sufficient </tt><tt>progress to extend </tt><pre style="margin: 0em;"></pre><tt>LGTM to extend to 135 inclusive (I guess it's a retroactive approval to </tt><tt>get 6 milestones instead of the 2 you originally requested). </tt><pre style="margin: 0em;"></pre><pre>
On 12/17/24 2:52 PM, Chris Fredrickson wrote: </pre><blockquote style="border-left: #5555EE solid 0.2em; margin: 0em; padding-left: 0.85em"><tt>Following up on this - we'd like to amend this I2EE to request an </tt><tt>extension for another *3* milestones, to M135, to give ourselves more </tt><tt>buffer to resolve any issues. (We understand that a feature may run an </tt><tt>origin trial for up to 6 milestones. The first release with this OT </tt><tt>was M130.) </tt><pre style="margin: 0em;"></pre><tt>We still see shipping in M133 as a possibility, provided that we </tt><tt>resolve Mozilla's outstanding concern quickly. We're working to do so </tt><tt>and plan to send an I2S for review once it is resolved. </tt><pre style="margin: 0em;">
On Wednesday, December 11, 2024 at 3:51:17 PM UTC-5 Sam LeDoux wrote:
Alex,
Thank you for the context, and that caveat sounds fair. To answer your question, we have not seen much traffic under the current OT.
Best, Sam LeDoux
On Wed, Dec 11, 2024 at 11:33 AM Alex Russell <slightly...@chromium.org> wrote:
Hey Sam,
Thanks for the updates.
We discussed this at this morning's API OWNERS meeting, and given that there's some renaming risk, it sounds like there's support to extend you past the 1 extra milestone you're asking for under the caveat that breaking changes (e.g., a renaming) be implemented ASAP. Is there much traffic under the current OT?
Best,
Alex
On Wednesday, December 11, 2024 at 5:06:24 AM UTC-8 Sam LeDoux wrote:
Mike,
Thank you for the response. To address your comments:
This is trending positive, but
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/mozilla/standards-positions/issues/1084#issuecomment-2471319900">https://github.com/mozilla/standards-positions/issues/1084#issuecomment-2471319900</a>
<<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/mozilla/standards-positions/issues/1084#issuecomment-2471319900">https://github.com/mozilla/standards-positions/issues/1084#issuecomment-2471319900</a>> some possible renaming. Can we try to sort that out with Mozilla before shipping?
Thank you for pointing this out, we will discuss the naming with Mozilla again.
What feedback have you received so far from participants?
One piece of feedback we received was that the SAH retry behavior with cross-site redirects was unintuitive, which led us to create this issue <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/privacycg/storage-access/issues/210">https://github.com/privacycg/storage-access/issues/210</a>>, and update the behavior in chromium <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/6020980">https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/6020980</a>> accordingly.
This rationale sounds like using the OT as a soft-launch, which isn't great. Do you think your partners will learn something in the requested extra 4 weeks such that you might meaningfully incorporate the feedback ahead of a launch? (I think the answer is probably no, but I'd love to hear your perspective).
One of our main motivators for extending the origin trial was feedback from a partner that they have not had a chance to begin experimenting and would appreciate having an additional milestone to do so. An extra 4 weeks may not be much time, but having any additional feedback from this partner experimenting would be helpful ahead of the launch.
Can you also comment on substantial progress for the following (as relevant), since the original OT?
* Draft spec (early draft is ok, but must be spec-like and associated with the appropriate standardization venue, or WICG)
We have published a spec since the original OT, here <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://privacycg.github.io/storage-access-headers/">https://privacycg.github.io/storage-access-headers/</a>>. A link can also be found in the platform status entry.
* WPT tests
We have written a suite of WPTs for Storage Access Headers that were recently merged into the wpt repo <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/web-platform-tests/wpt/pull/49502">https://github.com/web-platform-tests/wpt/pull/49502</a>>.
Best, Sam LeDoux
On Tue, Dec 10, 2024, 8:14 AM Mike Taylor <miketa...@chromium.org> wrote:
On 12/9/24 3:39 PM, 'Sam LeDoux' via blink-dev wrote:
</pre><blockquote style="border-left: #5555EE solid 0.2em; margin: 0em; padding-left: 0.85em"><pre style="margin: 0em;">
Contact emails
sled...@google.com <<a rel="nofollow" href="mailto:sled...@google.com">mailto:sled...@google.com</a>>, johann...@chromium.org <<a rel="nofollow" href="mailto:johann...@chromium.org">mailto:johann...@chromium.org</a>>, cfred...@chromium.org <<a rel="nofollow" href="mailto:cfred...@chromium.org">mailto:cfred...@chromium.org</a>>
Explainer
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/privacycg/storage-access-headers">https://github.com/privacycg/storage-access-headers</a> <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/privacycg/storage-access-headers">https://github.com/privacycg/storage-access-headers</a>>
Specification
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://privacycg.github.io/storage-access-headers">https://privacycg.github.io/storage-access-headers</a> <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://privacycg.github.io/storage-access-headers">https://privacycg.github.io/storage-access-headers</a>>
Summary
Storage Access Headers offer an alternate way for authenticated embeds to opt in for unpartitioned cookies. These headers indicate whether embedded resources would like to load with permission they have already been granted, reducing loads and latency overall for these use cases.
Blink component
Blink>StorageAccessAPI
<<a rel="nofollow" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/list?q=component:Blink%3EStorageAccessAPI">https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/list?q=component:Blink%3EStorageAccessAPI</a>>
Search tags
storage access api <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/features#tags:storage%20access%20api">https://chromestatus.com/features#tags:storage%20access%20api</a>>, storage access headers
<<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/features#tags:storage%20access%20headers">https://chromestatus.com/features#tags:storage%20access%20headers</a>>
TAG review
Not needed, per <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/w3ctag/design-reviews/issues/982">https://github.com/w3ctag/design-reviews/issues/982</a> <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/w3ctag/design-reviews/issues/982">https://github.com/w3ctag/design-reviews/issues/982</a>>.
TAG review status
Not applicable
</pre></blockquote><pre style="margin: 0em;"> (This should probably be changed to Resolution: satisfied, per the above link) </pre><blockquote style="border-left: #5555EE solid 0.2em; margin: 0em; padding-left: 0.85em"><pre style="margin: 0em;">
Origin Trial Name
Storage Access Headers
Chromium Trial Name
StorageAccessHeader
Origin Trial documentation link
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/cfredric/storage-access-headers">https://github.com/cfredric/storage-access-headers</a> <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/cfredric/storage-access-headers">https://github.com/cfredric/storage-access-headers</a>>
WebFeature UseCounter name
kStorageAccessAPI_requestStorageAccess_Method
Risks
Interoperability and Compatibility
This feature poses minor compatibility risk, since the Origin header is now included on requests that include the "Sec-Fetch-Storage-Access: inactive" header - and some servers do not yet properly handle the Origin header. However, this risk is low, because:
* The "inactive" header is only included on clients that already block third-party cookies.
* The presence of the "inactive" header implies that the request is cross-site, and that the site in question already uses the Storage Access API (which is relatively new to the web platform) or that the context is an "A > B > A" embedding scenario (which are not expected to be common).
* This feature omits the Origin header from requests whose `credentials` mode is not "include".
Gecko: No signal (<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/mozilla/standards-positions/issues/1084">https://github.com/mozilla/standards-positions/issues/1084</a> <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/mozilla/standards-positions/issues/1084">https://github.com/mozilla/standards-positions/issues/1084</a>>)
</pre></blockquote><pre style="margin: 0em;"> This is trending positive, but
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/mozilla/standards-positions/issues/1084#issuecomment-2471319900">https://github.com/mozilla/standards-positions/issues/1084#issuecomment-2471319900</a>
<<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/mozilla/standards-positions/issues/1084#issuecomment-2471319900">https://github.com/mozilla/standards-positions/issues/1084#issuecomment-2471319900</a>> some possible renaming. Can we try to sort that out with Mozilla before shipping? </pre><blockquote style="border-left: #5555EE solid 0.2em; margin: 0em; padding-left: 0.85em"><pre style="margin: 0em;">
WebKit: No signal (<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WebKit/standards-positions/issues/412">https://github.com/WebKit/standards-positions/issues/412</a> <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WebKit/standards-positions/issues/412">https://github.com/WebKit/standards-positions/issues/412</a>>)
Web developers: Positive (<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/privacycg/storage-access/issues/130">https://github.com/privacycg/storage-access/issues/130</a> <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/privacycg/storage-access/issues/130">https://github.com/privacycg/storage-access/issues/130</a>>) Other feature requests: * <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/privacycg/storage-access/issues/170">https://github.com/privacycg/storage-access/issues/170</a> <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/privacycg/storage-access/issues/170">https://github.com/privacycg/storage-access/issues/170</a>>* <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/privacycg/storage-access/issues/189">https://github.com/privacycg/storage-access/issues/189</a> <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/privacycg/storage-access/issues/189">https://github.com/privacycg/storage-access/issues/189</a>>
Other signals:
WebView application risks
None
Goals for experimentation
This experiment would allow us to receive and incorporate feedback on the browser's application of the `Sec-Fetch-Storage-Access` request header, as well as the browser's handling of the `Activate-Storage-Access` header before the feature is fully launched.
</pre></blockquote><pre style="margin: 0em;"> What feedback have you received so far from participants? </pre><blockquote style="border-left: #5555EE solid 0.2em; margin: 0em; padding-left: 0.85em"><pre style="margin: 0em;">
Reason this experiment is being extended
We are currently targeting M133 for the stable launch of Storage Access Headers; therefore, we would like to extend the Origin Trial to last through M132, as partners have expressed a desire to continue experimenting with the Storage Access Headers feature up until it begins launching to stable.
</pre></blockquote><pre style="margin: 0em;"> This rationale sounds like using the OT as a soft-launch, which isn't great. Do you think your partners will learn something in the requested extra 4 weeks such that you might meaningfully incorporate the feedback ahead of a launch? (I think the answer is probably no, but I'd love to hear your perspective).
Can you also comment on substantial progress for the following (as relevant), since the original OT?
* Draft spec (early draft is ok, but must be spec-like and associated with the appropriate standardization venue, or WICG) * TAG review (see exceptions) * bit.ly/blink-signals <<a rel="nofollow" href="http://bit.ly/blink-signals">http://bit.ly/blink-signals</a>> requests * Outreach for feedback from the spec community * WPT tests
</pre><blockquote style="border-left: #5555EE solid 0.2em; margin: 0em; padding-left: 0.85em"><pre style="margin: 0em;">
Ongoing technical constraints
None
Debuggability
Currently best debugged via chrome://net-export logs, as Chrome DevTools does not show the full chain of network events. We may add improved debugging capabilities in the future.
Will this feature be supported on all six Blink platforms (Windows, Mac, Linux, ChromeOS, Android, and Android WebView)?
No.
Supported for Mac, Windows, Linux, Chrome OS, and Android.
Is this feature fully tested by web-platform-tests
<<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/docs/testing/web_platform_tests.md">https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/docs/testing/web_platform_tests.md</a>>?
Yes
Flag name on chrome://flags
#storage-access-headers
Requires code in //chrome?
Yes
Tracking bug
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://issues.chromium.org/issues/332335089">https://issues.chromium.org/issues/332335089</a> <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://issues.chromium.org/issues/332335089">https://issues.chromium.org/issues/332335089</a>>
Launch bug
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://launch.corp.google.com/launch/4309903">https://launch.corp.google.com/launch/4309903</a> <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://launch.corp.google.com/launch/4309903">https://launch.corp.google.com/launch/4309903</a>>
Estimated milestones
Shipping on desktop
133
Origin trial desktop first
130
Origin trial desktop last
131
Origin trial extension 1 end milestone
132
DevTrial on desktop
130
Shipping on Android
133
Origin trial Android first
130
Origin trial Android last
131
DevTrial on Android
130
Link to entry on the Chrome Platform Status
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/feature/6146353156849664?gate=5788202676518912">https://chromestatus.com/feature/6146353156849664?gate=5788202676518912</a>
<<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/feature/6146353156849664?gate=5788202676518912">https://chromestatus.com/feature/6146353156849664?gate=5788202676518912</a>>
Links to previous Intent discussions
Intent to Prototype:
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/CABa1CXyMJzMmpQkZMwQUFGK8-f%3DEerhR2VQbTZephdmE22W%2ByA%40mail.gmail.com">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/CABa1CXyMJzMmpQkZMwQUFGK8-f%3DEerhR2VQbTZephdmE22W%2ByA%40mail.gmail.com</a>
<<a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/CABa1CXyMJzMmpQkZMwQUFGK8-f%3DEerhR2VQbTZephdmE22W%2ByA%40mail.gmail.com">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/CABa1CXyMJzMmpQkZMwQUFGK8-f%3DEerhR2VQbTZephdmE22W%2ByA%40mail.gmail.com</a>>
Intent to Experiment:
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/CABa1CXyYbxwh%3DPdnigTW80d9jez_835R1SV1bQPDjvk1ra5G4g%40mail.gmail.com">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/CABa1CXyYbxwh%3DPdnigTW80d9jez_835R1SV1bQPDjvk1ra5G4g%40mail.gmail.com</a>

entry.title: [blink-dev] Intent to Ship: ARIA Notify API
entry.summary: [blink-dev] Intent to Ship: ARIA Notify API
entry.content:
<div class="msgHead"> <h1> <span class="subject"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=subject:%22%5C%5Bblink%5C-dev%5C%5D+Intent+to+Ship%5C%3A+ARIA+Notify+API%22&o=newest" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="name">[blink-dev] Intent to Ship: ARIA Notify API</span></a></span> </h1> <p class="darkgray font13"> <span class="sender pipe"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=from:%22%27Jacques+Newman%27+via+blink%5C-dev%22" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">'Jacques Newman' via blink-dev</span></span></a></span> <span class="date"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=date:20250722" rel="nofollow">Tue, 22 Jul 2025 15:51:17 -0700</a></span> </p> </div><div itemprop="articleBody" class="msgBody">
<pre>Contact emails
alma...@microsoft.com<<a rel="nofollow" href="mailto:alma...@microsoft.com">mailto:alma...@microsoft.com</a>>, janew...@microsoft.com<<a rel="nofollow" href="mailto:janew...@microsoft.com">mailto:janew...@microsoft.com</a>>, leo...@microsoft.com<<a rel="nofollow" href="mailto:leo...@microsoft.com">mailto:leo...@microsoft.com</a>></pre><pre>
Explainer
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/MicrosoftEdge/MSEdgeExplainers/blob/main/Accessibility/AriaNotify/explainer.md">https://github.com/MicrosoftEdge/MSEdgeExplainers/blob/main/Accessibility/AriaNotify/explainer.md</a>
Specification
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/w3c/aria/pull/2577">https://github.com/w3c/aria/pull/2577</a>
Design docs
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1tFT-4_sDvgnZoS8AYEcQquXzqAYaoB53DBH0C2T5rMk">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1tFT-4_sDvgnZoS8AYEcQquXzqAYaoB53DBH0C2T5rMk</a>
Summary
ariaNotify provides a JavaScript API that enables content authors to directly tell a screen reader what to read. ariaNotify improves reliability and developer control compared to ARIA live regions, allowing for announcing changes not tied to DOM updates. This enables more consistent and ergonomic accessibility experiences across dynamic web applications. Iframe usage of this feature can be controlled via a permission policy "aria-notify".
Blink component
Blink>Accessibility<<a rel="nofollow" href="https://issues.chromium.org/issues?q=customfield1222907:%22Blink%3EAccessibility%22">https://issues.chromium.org/issues?q=customfield1222907:%22Blink%3EAccessibility%22</a>>
TAG review
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/w3ctag/design-reviews/issues/1075">https://github.com/w3ctag/design-reviews/issues/1075</a>
TAG review status
Issues addressed
Risks
Interoperability and Compatibility
Gecko: Defer (<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/mozilla/standards-positions/issues/1049">https://github.com/mozilla/standards-positions/issues/1049</a>)
WebKit: No signal (<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WebKit/standards-positions/issues/370">https://github.com/WebKit/standards-positions/issues/370</a>)
Web developers: Positive (<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/w3c/aria/issues/832">https://github.com/w3c/aria/issues/832</a>) Blog post asking for the feature: <a rel="nofollow" href="https://www.nicchan.me/blog/please-can-we-have-aria-notify/">https://www.nicchan.me/blog/please-can-we-have-aria-notify/</a> See section after the I2S template for more web developer verbatim feedback. Other signals:
WebView application risks
Does this intent deprecate or change behavior of existing APIs, such that it has potentially high risk for Android WebView-based applications?
None
Debuggability
I have verified that devtools autocomplete works as expected when the feature flag is enabled.
Will this feature be supported on all six Blink platforms (Windows, Mac, Linux, ChromeOS, Android, and Android WebView)?
No
This API requires platform specific APIs to communicate the notification to screen readers, and this has not yet been implemented in ChromeOS.
Is this feature fully tested by web-platform-tests<<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/docs/testing/web_platform_tests.md">https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/docs/testing/web_platform_tests.md</a>>?
No
Web platform tests do not currently have the ability to monitor platform-specific accessibility APIs, [Acacia AAM](<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/Igalia/rfcs/blob/wpt-for-aams-rfc/rfcs/wpt-for-aams.md">https://github.com/Igalia/rfcs/blob/wpt-for-aams-rfc/rfcs/wpt-for-aams.md</a>) will close this gap and allow for testing of such features within WPT
Flag name on about://flags
Finch feature name
AriaNotify
Rollout plan
Will ship enabled for all users
Requires code in //chrome?
False
Tracking bug
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://issues.chromium.org/issues/326277796">https://issues.chromium.org/issues/326277796</a>
Estimated milestones
Shipping on desktop
140
Shipping on Android
140
Anticipated spec changes
Open questions about a feature may be a source of future web compat or interop issues. Please list open issues (e.g. links to known github issues in the project for the feature specification) whose resolution may introduce web compat/interop risk (e.g., changing to naming or structure of the API in a non-backward-compatible way).
All open spec issues can be resolved with backwards compatible additions. Recent conversations in the tag review showcase what an backwards-compatible extension might look like and the Mozilla standards position thread go over all of the open issues and how they can be resolved in the future in a backwards-compatible way. Open Issues link: <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/w3c/aria/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aopen+%5BAriaNotify%5D">https://github.com/w3c/aria/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aopen+%5BAriaNotify%5D</a>
Link to entry on the Chrome Platform Status
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/feature/5745430754230272?gate=5410577665490944">https://chromestatus.com/feature/5745430754230272?gate=5410577665490944</a>
Links to previous Intent discussions
Intent to Prototype: <a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/CH2PR00MB0680B14C1978202FF59CF7D3F2239%40CH2PR00MB0680.namprd00.prod.outlook.com">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/CH2PR00MB0680B14C1978202FF59CF7D3F2239%40CH2PR00MB0680.namprd00.prod.outlook.com</a>
This intent message was generated by Chrome Platform Status<<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/">https://chromestatus.com/</a>>.
Quotes from Web Developers:
>From Steve at Desmos, a graphing calculator web application:
"We are enthusiastic about integrating the new ariaNotify() API into our suite of Desmos tools. Across our platform-including in our customized fork of the open-source MathQuill equation editor, our graph sonification feature known as Audio Trace, and interactive geometry construction tools-we frequently provide screen reader users with real-time feedback via custom spoken messages. Historically, we have implemented these notifications by updating hidden document fragments with aria-live attributes. While this approach has served us reasonably well, it has a significant limitation that has long remained unresolved: screen readers will not re-announce the same message, even if the user explicitly requests it. This presents a notable usability issue. For example, if a user types the same digit repeatedly, navigates through a list of identical elements, or invokes a command to re-speak the most recent message, screen readers often remain silent. In minor cases, this forces users to take indirect actions just to hear the content again, while in more severe instances, it creates confusion or the appearance of a software defect beyond our control.
The ariaNotify() API represents a promising and long-overdue improvement. Assuming timely and consistent adoption by browser and assistive technology vendors, this new mechanism will allow us to reliably deliver repeated announcements when appropriate-eliminating the need for fragile workarounds and improving the overall accessibility and responsiveness of our tools."
-Steve
>From Sarah Higley on Fluent, a framework developed by Microsoft:
"We have already implemented ariaNotify in Fluent on browsers where it is supported, in lieu of our DOM-based notification utility. The ariaNotify implementation gives us a more robust announcement utility in several key aspects:
It works even when a modal dialog is open on the page
Managing multiple notifications in succession is more robust across platforms
It requires significantly less code, testing, maintenance, and edge case handling from our side.
Debugging live region announcements consistently accounts for a disproportionate amount of debugging effort and bugs especially from our partner teams, and transitioning more and more towards only supporting the ariaNotify implementation would be a big time saver for us, and deliver a more robust experience to our users."
-Sarah Higley
-- You received this message because you are subscribed to the Google Groups "blink-dev" group. To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to blink-dev+unsubscr...@chromium.org. To view this discussion visit <a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/CH4PR00MB2302D315E668B3CD0168C9C98B5CA%40CH4PR00MB2302.namprd00.prod.outlook.com">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/CH4PR00MB2302D315E668B3CD0168C9C98B5CA%40CH4PR00MB2302.namprd00.prod.outlook.com</a>. </pre>
</div>

entry.title: [blink-dev] Intent to Experiment: WebAssembly Custom Descriptors
entry.summary: [blink-dev] Intent to Experiment: WebAssembly Custom Descriptors
entry.content:
<div class="msgHead"> <h1> <span class="subject"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=subject:%22%5C%5Bblink%5C-dev%5C%5D+Intent+to+Experiment%5C%3A+WebAssembly+Custom+Descriptors%22&o=newest" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="name">[blink-dev] Intent to Experiment: WebAssembly Custom Descriptors</span></a></span> </h1> <p class="darkgray font13"> <span class="sender pipe"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=from:%22%27Thomas+Lively%27+via+blink%5C-dev%22" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">'Thomas Lively' via blink-dev</span></span></a></span> <span class="date"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=date:20250811" rel="nofollow">Mon, 11 Aug 2025 16:02:34 -0700</a></span> </p> </div><div itemprop="articleBody" class="msgBody">
<pre>Contact emailstliv...@google.com, ecmzieg...@chromium.org, jkumme...@chromium.org</pre><pre>
Explainer <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WebAssembly/custom-descriptors/blob/main/proposals/custom-rtts/Overview.md">https://github.com/WebAssembly/custom-descriptors/blob/main/proposals/custom-rtts/Overview.md</a> <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WebAssembly/custom-rtts/blob/main/proposals/custom-rtts/Overview.md">https://github.com/WebAssembly/custom-rtts/blob/main/proposals/custom-rtts/Overview.md</a>>
Specification <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WebAssembly/custom-descriptors/blob/main/proposals/custom-descriptors/Overview.md">https://github.com/WebAssembly/custom-descriptors/blob/main/proposals/custom-descriptors/Overview.md</a>
Summary
Allows WebAssembly to store data associated with source-level types more efficiently in new "custom descriptor" objects. These custom descriptors can be configured with prototypes for the WebAssembly objects of that source-level type. This allows methods to be installed on a WebAssembly object's prototype chain and called directly from JS using normal method call syntax. The prototypes and methods can be configured declaratively using an imported builtin function.
Blink componentBlink>JavaScript>WebAssembly <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://issues.chromium.org/issues?q=customfield1222907:%22Blink%3EJavaScript%3EWebAssembly%22">https://issues.chromium.org/issues?q=customfield1222907:%22Blink%3EJavaScript%3EWebAssembly%22</a>>
TAG reviewNone
TAG review statusPending
Origin Trial documentation link <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WebAssembly/custom-descriptors/blob/main/proposals/custom-descriptors/Overview.md">https://github.com/WebAssembly/custom-descriptors/blob/main/proposals/custom-descriptors/Overview.md</a>
Risks
Interoperability and Compatibility
None
*Gecko*: No signal
*WebKit*: No signal
*Web developers*: No signals
*Other signals*:
WebView application risks
Does this intent deprecate or change behavior of existing APIs, such that it has potentially high risk for Android WebView-based applications?
None
Goals for experimentation Initially we are looking to measure real-world performance, heap usage, and OOM rate impact of just the core Wasm part of the proposal. We want to verify that heap usage and OOM rates will decrease as expected and that the performance impact is negligible. If we do measure a performance impact, that will inform additional optimization work we would need to do in the implementation. Notably, the JS interop features of the proposal are out of scope for this initial experimentation. They will likely be evaluated in follow-on experiments.
Ongoing technical constraints
None.
Debuggability
None
Will this feature be supported on all six Blink platforms (Windows, Mac, Linux, ChromeOS, Android, and Android WebView)?No
Is this feature fully tested by web-platform-tests <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/docs/testing/web_platform_tests.md">https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/docs/testing/web_platform_tests.md</a>> ?No
Flag name on about://flagsNone
Finch feature nameNone
Non-finch justificationNone
Requires code in //chrome?False
Estimated milestones Origin trial desktop first 141 Origin trial desktop last 147
Link to entry on the Chrome Platform Status <a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/feature/6024844719947776?gate=5062088692858880">https://chromestatus.com/feature/6024844719947776?gate=5062088692858880</a>
This intent message was generated by Chrome Platform Status <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/">https://chromestatus.com/</a>>.
-- You received this message because you are subscribed to the Google Groups "blink-dev" group. To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to blink-dev+unsubscr...@chromium.org. To view this discussion visit <a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/CAJZD_EWidxA-LogDRBnDVM9cOMbu3OX3_3onqCZcSLVJm7%3DnvA%40mail.gmail.com">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/CAJZD_EWidxA-LogDRBnDVM9cOMbu3OX3_3onqCZcSLVJm7%3DnvA%40mail.gmail.com</a>. </pre>
</div>

entry.title: Re: [blink-dev] Intent to Ship: Mobile and desktop parity for select element rendering modes
entry.summary: Re: [blink-dev] Intent to Ship: Mobile and desktop parity for select element rendering modes
entry.content:
<div class="msgHead"> <h1> <span class="subject"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=subject:%22Re%5C%3A+%5C%5Bblink%5C-dev%5C%5D+Intent+to+Ship%5C%3A+Mobile+and+desktop+parity+for+select+element+rendering+modes%22&o=newest" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="name">Re: [blink-dev] Intent to Ship: Mobile and desktop parity for select element rendering modes</span></a></span> </h1> <p class="darkgray font13"> <span class="sender pipe"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=from:%22Mike+Taylor%22" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">Mike Taylor</span></span></a></span> <span class="date"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=date:20250917" rel="nofollow">Wed, 17 Sep 2025 12:43:24 -0700</a></span> </p> </div><div itemprop="articleBody" class="msgBody">
<pre style="margin: 0em;"> What's the status of the spec PR?
On 9/4/25 9:54 p.m., TAMURA, Kent wrote: </pre><blockquote style="border-left: #5555EE solid 0.2em; margin: 0em; padding-left: 0.85em"><tt>LGTM1. The consistent behavior is reasonable, and the compatibility </tt><tt>risk looks very small. </tt><pre style="margin: 0em;"></pre><pre>
On Fri, Sep 5, 2025 at 2:42 AM Joey Arhar <jar...@chromium.org> wrote:
Contact emails
jar...@chromium.org
Explainer
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/8189#issuecomment-2877242732">https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/8189#issuecomment-2877242732</a>
Specification
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/whatwg/html/pull/11460">https://github.com/whatwg/html/pull/11460</a>
Summary
By using the size and multiple attributes, the select element can be rendered as an in-page listbox or a button with a popup. However, these modes are not consistently available across mobile and desktop chrome. Currently, in-page listbox rendering is not available on mobile, and button with popup is not available on desktop when the multiple attribute is present. This feature adds the listbox to mobile and adds a multi-select popup to desktop, and makes the opt-ins with the size and multiple attributes result in the same rendering mode across mobile and desktop. Here is a summary of the changes: - When the size attribute has a value greater than 1, in-page rendering will always be used. Previously, this was ignored on mobile and always resulted in a popup. - When the multiple attribute is set with no size attribute, in-page rendering will be used. Previously, this was a popup instead of an in-page listbox on mobile. - When the multiple attribute is set with size=1, a popup will be used. Previously, this was an in-page listbox on desktop. By making this change, we are providing a foundation to bring customizable select to in-page rendering and multi-select. Customizable select currently only works for single-selects with a popup.
Here is a screenshot of the new multi-select popup for desktop, which you'll get with <select multiple size=1>. This was created to reach parity with the previously existing multi-select popup on android.
479732188-e42f4512-1059-4bae-85ed-00e2dee2a967.png
Blink component
Blink>Forms>Select
<<a rel="nofollow" href="https://issues.chromium.org/issues?q=customfield1222907:%22Blink%3EForms%3ESelect%22">https://issues.chromium.org/issues?q=customfield1222907:%22Blink%3EForms%3ESelect%22</a>>
TAG review
None
TAG review status
Not applicable
Risks
Interoperability and Compatibility
Interop risk is low because of the positive standards position from Mozilla and the lack of blocking feedback from Apple in many standards discussions. There is a compat risk of breaking existing usage of select multiple on mobile which currently always uses a picker but will be changed to use the in-page listbox to match desktop. If there are any mobile sites relying on this particular rendering mode, they will have to add the size=1 attribute to their select element. I added a UseCounter to see how often users open a select multiple picker on mobile, and the usage is quite low: <a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/metrics/feature/timeline/popularity/5549">https://chromestatus.com/metrics/feature/timeline/popularity/5549</a>
/Gecko/: Positive (<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/mozilla/standards-positions/issues/1274">https://github.com/mozilla/standards-positions/issues/1274</a>)
/WebKit/: No signal (<a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WebKit/standards-positions/issues/532">https://github.com/WebKit/standards-positions/issues/532</a>)
/Web developers/: No signals
/Other signals/:
Ergonomics
I expect the in-page rendering mode to be used in tandem with customizable select in the future when customizable select is expanded to include the in-page listbox rendering mode. The default usage of this API will not make it hard for chrome to maintain good performance.
Activation
It will not be challenging for developers to take advantage of this feature immediately.
Security
I don't believe there are any security risks for this feature.
WebView application risks
Does this intent deprecate or change behavior of existing APIs, such that it has potentially high risk for Android WebView-based applications?
None
Debuggability
DevTools shows the attributes on the select element in the elements panel, but doesn't explain the logic for how the size and multiple attributes result in the different rendering modes. I expect this to be documented on MDN so developers can learn how to control this.
Will this feature be supported on all six Blink platforms (Windows, Mac, Linux, ChromeOS, Android, and Android WebView)?
Yes
Is this feature fully tested by web-platform-tests
<<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/docs/testing/web_platform_tests.md">https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/docs/testing/web_platform_tests.md</a>>?
No
There is not a good way to test the native appearance of the select element, and there is no way to test whether the select element is in a mode which supports a picker or not.
Flag name on about://flags
None
Finch feature name
SelectMobileDesktopParity
Rollout plan
(RARE) Experiment users ramp up over time
Requires code in //chrome?
False
Tracking bug
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://issues.chromium.org/issues/439964654">https://issues.chromium.org/issues/439964654</a>
Estimated milestones
Finch in 141, enable by default in 142
Anticipated spec changes
Open questions about a feature may be a source of future web compat or interop issues. Please list open issues (e.g. links to known github issues in the project for the feature specification) whose resolution may introduce web compat/interop risk (e.g., changing to naming or structure of the API in a non-backward-compatible way).
None
Link to entry on the Chrome Platform Status
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/feature/5412736871825408?gate=6327273552740352">https://chromestatus.com/feature/5412736871825408?gate=6327273552740352</a>
This intent message was generated by Chrome Platform Status <<a rel="nofollow" href="https://chromestatus.com/">https://chromestatus.com/</a>>. </pre><tt> -- </tt><tt> You received this message because you are subscribed to the Google </tt><pre style="margin: 0em;"> Groups "blink-dev" group. To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to blink-dev+unsubscr...@chromium.org. To view this discussion visit
<a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/CAK6btwLEPi_ObWz9KhGJwsH2088%2BrDVJfUDFSin2SUBwNNkznw%40mail.gmail.com">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/CAK6btwLEPi_ObWz9KhGJwsH2088%2BrDVJfUDFSin2SUBwNNkznw%40mail.gmail.com</a>
<<a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/CAK6btwLEPi_ObWz9KhGJwsH2088%2BrDVJfUDFSin2SUBwNNkznw%40mail.gmail.com?utm_medium=email&utm_source=footer">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/CAK6btwLEPi_ObWz9KhGJwsH2088%2BrDVJfUDFSin2SUBwNNkznw%40mail.gmail.com?utm_medium=email&utm_source=footer</a>>.
-- TAMURA Kent Software Engineer, Google
-- </pre><tt>You received this message because you are subscribed to the Google </tt><tt>Groups "blink-dev" group. </tt><tt>To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send </tt><tt>an email to blink-dev+unsubscr...@chromium.org. </tt><tt>To view this discussion visit </tt><tt><a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/CAGH7WqGnr6QfsbJ8Z8PH5ZAyK8C8t4UZVTeiG3Eaxh7zqC-stw%40mail.gmail.com">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/CAGH7WqGnr6QfsbJ8Z8PH5ZAyK8C8t4UZVTeiG3Eaxh7zqC-stw%40mail.gmail.com</a> </tt><tt><<a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/CAGH7WqGnr6QfsbJ8Z8PH5ZAyK8C8t4UZVTeiG3Eaxh7zqC-stw%40mail.gmail.com?utm_medium=email&utm_source=footer">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/CAGH7WqGnr6QfsbJ8Z8PH5ZAyK8C8t4UZVTeiG3Eaxh7zqC-stw%40mail.gmail.com?utm_medium=email&utm_source=footer</a>>. </tt></blockquote><pre style="margin: 0em;">
-- You received this message because you are subscribed to the Google Groups "blink-dev" group. To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to blink-dev+unsubscr...@chromium.org. To view this discussion visit <a rel="nofollow" href="https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/2de828b9-3aec-4ffc-9701-0aa01f4a1c7a%40chromium.org">https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msgid/blink-dev/2de828b9-3aec-4ffc-9701-0aa01f4a1c7a%40chromium.org</a>. </pre>
</div>

entry.title: [blink-dev] Intent to Prototype: Navigation API: expose destination in navigation.transition
entry.summary: [blink-dev] Intent to Prototype: Navigation API: expose destination in navigation.transition
entry.content:
<div class="msgHead"> <h1> <span class="subject"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=subject:%22%5C%5Bblink%5C-dev%5C%5D+Intent+to+Prototype%5C%3A+Navigation+API%5C%3A+expose+destination+in+navigation.transition%22&o=newest" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="name">[blink-dev] Intent to Prototype: Navigation API: expose destination in navigation.transition</span></a></span> </h1> <p class="darkgray font13"> <span class="sender pipe"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=from:%22Chromestatus%22" rel="nofollow"><span itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person"><span itemprop="name">Chromestatus</span></span></a></span> <span class="date"><a href="/search?l=blink-dev@chromium.org&q=date:20250925" rel="nofollow">Thu, 25 Sep 2025 08:45:32 -0700</a></span> </p> </div><div itemprop="articleBody" class="msgBody">
<pre>Contact emails nrosent...@chromium.org </pre><pre>
Explainer None
Specification <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/whatwg/html/pull/11692">https://github.com/whatwg/html/pull/11692</a>
Summary Currently NavigationTransition has a "for" property, exposing the old URL of the navigation. Exposing "to" (a NavigationDestination) completes this. It is especially useful when using precommit handlers, as during precommit the current URL has not yet switched to the destination.
Blink component UI>Browser>Navigation
Web Feature ID navigation
Motivation Exposing things in navigation.transition helps curating the navigation experience without having to listen to *all* navigation events. Specifically, the to/from properties of navigation.transition map nicely to the to/from route matchers (see <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/WICG/declarative-partial-updates/blob/main/route-matching-explainer.md">https://github.com/WICG/declarative-partial-updates/blob/main/route-matching-explainer.md</a>)
Initial public proposal <a rel="nofollow" href="https://github.com/whatwg/html/pull/11692">https://github.com/whatwg/html/pull/11692</a>
TAG review None
TAG review status Pending

Web developers: No signals
